title: Manhattan Clam Chowder

ingredients.content: 3 oz thick cut bacon, diced (approx. ¼ in.)
3 oz celery, cut into 1 in. pieces (approx. 2 stalks)
3 oz carrots, cut into 1 in. pieces (approx. 1 medium carrot)
½ tsp cayenne pepper, to taste
¼ tsp dried chili flakes, to taste
19 ½ oz canned chopped clams (3 x 6.5 oz cans), reserve the clam juice
3 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves only (approx. 20 leaves)
½ tsp fine sea salt, to taste
1 tsp ground black pepper, to taste

preparations.content: Place butter and bacon into mixing bowl and without measuring cup sauté <b>10 min/250°F//speed 0.5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté a further <b>2 min/250°F//speed 0.5<b>. Leave approximately 2 tbsp of bacon fat in mixing bowl, drain bacon on paper towels and set aside.
Add onions, celery, carrots, garlic, cayenne and chili flakes. Chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and cook <b>5 min/250°F//speed 1<b>.
Drain clams through simmering basket into a bowl. Reserve clam juice (approx. 13 oz.) and set aside. Refrigerate clams until needed.

Place potatoes, tomatoes, reserved clam juice (plus additional clam juice to total 24 oz), thyme and reserved bacon into mixing bowl. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook <b>25 min/250°F/speed 1<b>.
Add reserved clams, salt and pepper and stir <b>1 min//speed 1<b>. Serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: Garnish with chopped fresh herbs, a drizzle of cream, and serve with sliced sourdough, garlic bread, or saltine crackers.

For a slightly clearer broth, replace crushed tomatoes with canned whole peeled tomatoes (including juice). Simply cut into pieces (approx. 1 in.) before adding into mixing bowl and continuing with the recipe.
